Package problem1

Class Theater

  • java.lang.Object
    • problem1.Theater
  • public class Theater
extends java.lang.Object
    Theater class containing the fields necessary to set up, build, and update a theater. A theater object contains rows, an arraylist of seats as well as its name. The theater maximum capacity is arbitrary and can be set based upon the venue in question.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Theater

        public Theater​(java.lang.String name,
               java.lang.Integer numberOfRows,
               java.lang.Integer numberOfSeats,
               java.lang.Integer numberOfWheelChairAccessibleRows)
        Constructor for a Theater object containing rows of seats, a name, and the number of wheelchair rows.
        Parameters:
        name - - the name of the theater, a String.
        numberOfRows - - the number of rows, an Integer.
        numberOfSeats - - the number of seats, an Integer.
        numberOfWheelChairAccessibleRows - - the number of wheelchair accessible rows, an Integer.

    • Method Detail

      • buildTheater

        public void buildTheater()
        Method that builds the theater, including all non wheelchair accessible and wheelchair accessible rows. Will also call helper methods to ensure that the theater specifications meet the requirements before and after the build.

      • printTheater

        public int printTheater()
        Method that displays a string representation of the theater when called.
        Returns:
        - returns a 1 when complete.

      • updateTheaterNoWheelchair

        public int updateTheaterNoWheelchair​(int reservedNumberSeats,
                                     java.lang.String answerName)
        A method that will update non-wheelchair accessible rows for a theater reservation.
        Parameters:
        reservedNumberSeats - - requires the intended number of seats for reservation, an Integer.
        answerName - - requires the reservation name, a String.
        Returns:
        will return an Integer (positive number = row of the reservation to be reported to the user, or a negative number indicating wheelchair rows need to be checked for seats for this reservation).

      • updateTheaterWheelchair

        public int updateTheaterWheelchair​(int reservedNumberSeats,
                                   java.lang.String answerName)
        A method that will update wheelchair accessible rows for a theater reservation.
        Parameters:
        reservedNumberSeats - - requires the intended number of seats for reservation, an Integer.
        answerName - - requires the reservation name, a String.
        Returns:
        will return an Integer (non-zero number = row of the reservation to be reported to the user. A zero return indicated the theater is completely filled for a reservation of this size.

      • getRowCollection

        public java.util.ArrayList<Row> getRowCollection()
        Getter for the theater rowCollection.
        Returns:
        the theater rowCollection, an Arraylist of Seats.

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Getter for the theater name.
        Returns:
        the name of the theater, a String.
